meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a glacier.
meanings.sent1: The mountain's glacial peak sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The landscape was covered in a glacial blanket of snow.
meanings.sent3: The glacial pace of the tortoise amused the spectators.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as cold and glacial as an icy stream.
meanings.sent5: The glacial silence of the room made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: The old computer operated at a glacial speed.
meanings.sent2: The wind outside was glacial, chilling everything in its path.
meanings.sent3: The glacial progress of the snail was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: His glacial stare sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The glacial waters of the lake were too cold for swimming.
